entry.title: St. Martin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the flat wooden ceiling of St. Martin (pictured), the Lutheran main church of Sindelfingen built in the 11th century, is still preserved?

entry.title: Cephas L. Bard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Cephas L. Bard, the first American physician in Ventura, California, was also the first person to die in the hospital he built there?

entry.title: Yarkand Massacre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that independent media and scholars estimate that thousands might have perished in the Yarkand Massacre in 2014?

entry.title: Reconstructing Womanhood (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Reconstructing Womanhood by Hazel Carby, about the history of American black women writers, was said to be a "landmark study" and "groundbreaking"?

entry.title: Henry Stock (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Henry Stock designed the Peek Freans factory where, in 1929, Twiglets were invented?

entry.title: Eurovision Song Contest 1957 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that despite a song duration limit of three minutes and thirty seconds at the Eurovision Song Contest 1957, the entry from Italy lasted over five minutes?

entry.title: Geliyoo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the search engine of Geliyoo was found to be retrieving its results from Google, in contrast to the company's claims of spending 10 million Turkish liras on development?

entry.title: Jamie "Canhead" Keeton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jamie "Canhead" Keeton is also known as the "human suction cup"?
